lesson.title: Audit ExampleCorp
lesson.summary: Use the skills you have developed in this course to manage a full-fledged security audit of a fictitious company called ExampleCorp

project.title: Audit ExampleCorp
project.description:
## Project Summary Example Corp. is a public relations and media firm that uses artificial intelligence-based marketing techniques to engage customers with interactive media. A recent phishing assessment revealed the need for a complete vulnerability audit of the company. Your task is to perform the audit by completing: * An automated vulnerability scan * A manual assessment of the vulnerabilities * An audit web application(s) You will prepare an assessment report that details all of your findings and share it as a `.pdf` file. ## Submission Checklist Before you submit, check if the following have been completed:
Project Rubric has been reviewed.
Automated vulnerability scan is complete.
Manual assessment of the vulnerabilities is complete.
Audit of the web application(s) is complete.
All required findings are documented in the Report.
Report has been saved as a .pdf file.
**Note**: The checklist above won't save your checkmarks so do this right before you plan to submit. ## Ready to Submit? Once you have all the items above completed, you can click the submit button. Follow the directions to submit your project as a single file.

atoms.title: ND350 EHND C1 L6 A01 Project Overview

atoms.text:
## Overview

ExampleCorp is a public relations and media firm that uses artificial intelligence-based marketing techniques 
to engage customers with interactive media.


Recently, a phishing assessment was done, and the results revealed a need for a complete vulnerability audit for the company. 

Further, the company is moving its infrastructure to a different cloud provider, and management is concerned about any HIGH or CRITICAL vulnerabilities requiring immediate attention.

atoms.title: ND350 EHND C1 L6 A02 Project Setup

atoms.text: ## Setting Up The Project For this project, you will be using two virtual machines: * **Analyst machine** - the machine you have used for all of the exercises in the course * **Target machine** - the machine you will be analyzing. 1. Install the latest version of VirtualBox. * Go to Download VirtualBox and follow the instructions for your operating system

2. Create a network segment on Virtual Box Nat Network

   - Go to **Tools** > **Preferences** > **Network**.
   - Click on the **plus** button to add a network.
   - Double click on the network to change the name and CIDR
     - **Network Name**: `ExCorpNet`
     - **Network CIDR**: `10.10.10.0/24`
   - Save the network and exit **Tools**.

atoms.caption: Settings to Create the ExCorpNet Network

atoms.text:
3. Import and install the virtual machines.  
   - Download [Analyst.ova](https://udacity-ehnd.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/Ethical+Hacker/Analyst.ova) and [Target.ova](https://udacity-ehnd.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/Ethical+Hacker/Target.ova)
   - Double click or right-click on each OVA file or click **File** > **Import Appliance** to load it into VirtualBox. 
   - Click on **Import** in the Appliance Settings page to create the virtual machine on your computer.

atoms.caption: Click **Import** to Create the Virtual Machine
atoms.alt: Click Import on the Appliances Settings page

atoms.text:
4. Assign the ExCorpNet network to **Adapter 1** on each machine

   - Click on **Settings** in the VirtualBox Manager
   - In the **Network** tab select `ExCorpNet` in the dropdown box for **Name**
   - **Save** the settings
5. Start both machines by right-clicking on the machine, selecting **Start** > **Normal Start**

6. Test the installation.

   - Login to the Analyst machine
     - username: `root`
     - password: `toor`
- Click on the menu button in the upper right corner of the VM window and select **Web Browser**
* Navigate to http://example.com/. You should see the ExampleCorp website.

## Project Instructions ### 1. Perform an automated vulnerability scan and upload results to the Faraday for analysis * Run a custom scan as per Policy_NS_Q3 . You'll need to use an **Advanced Scan** to configure this. * Export the Nessus scan results as `.nessus` file. * Use the **Nessus Plugin** in the Faraday client to import the Nessus Scan and manage it. ***Note: Credentials for Faraday are root:toor***

### 2. Perform a manual assessment on services flagged as **high** or **critical** * Run the scan per Policy_VA_Q3 * Use ***only*** the trusted sources given in the Policy_VA_Q3 for this assessment. Anything not on the list of trusted sources is considered unsafe as per company rules. For example, using Github to download exploits/PoC is allowed but using ExploitDB is not. * Use ***only*** the tools and programs listed in the **Tools & Programs Allowed** list * Test only code execution vulnerabilities on the service rated **high** or **critical** in the Nessus scan. * Modifying code is allowed. #### ***Hints***: * Chaining two vulnerabilities is allowed. If you use chaining you'll need to adjust the CVSS score via **Environmental Score Adjustments**. * You can take help from Google, YouTube, etc., as they are trusted sources For research. * You may choose to get a shell on the target system but this is not required. We are only looking for proof that the vulnerability exists. Remember, Itâ€™s not about breaking things. We are doing this to secure the company.

### 3.  Audit web application(s) per Policy_VA_Q3
- Port 80 and 443 are open on the target machine. Your goal is to test the web application running on those ports.

- You may not use a previously found vulnerability on the target machine from the network audit in this web audit. If you managed to access a shell on the target machine, close that connection. Your goal is to crack this one from outside, not from inside.

#### ***Hint*** 
- Sometimes, what you see is just an illusion. Try first to understand your target and go through the information about what you already have.

### 4. Prepare an Assessment Report per Policy_VA_Q3 * Write the report following the Security Report Template*. * The report must include: 1. Executive Summary 1. Target Security Posture 1. Testing Methodology 1. Tools & Websites Used 1. Detailed Technical Reports for found vulnerabilities including * Vulnerability description * Exposures/Analysis * Recommendations * Steps to reproduce 1. Vulnerability Score Analysis using NIST CVSS 3.0 calculator 1. Modified Exploit Code 1. Nessus & Faraday screenshots 1. Screenshots of exploited web app 1. OSINT / Phishing Results Data Used * Save your report as a `.pdf` file for submission #### *Note about the template: The template is a `.docx` format that can be opened using most popular word-processing systems, including Microsoft Word and Google Docs. To use the worksheet in Google Docs: 1. Upload the document to your Google Drive 1. Click **Open with Google Docs** at the top of the screen

atoms.title: Project Completion Checklist
tasks: Manual assessment of the vulnerabilities is complete
Audit of the web application(s) is complete
All required findings are documented in the Report
Report has been saved as a `.pdf` file
atoms.positive_feedback: Congratulations! It looks like you are ready to submit the project!
